section.para: Allocate a new Access Control Entry with an appropriately aligned principal name, if applicable.
Only User and Group types use principal name.

entry.para: Type of principal for the ACE

section.title: daos_acl_add_ace()

para.computeroutput: int daos_acl_add_ace (struct daos_acl ** acl, struct daos_ace * new_ace)

section.para: Insert an Access Control Entry in the appropriate location in the ACE list. The expected order is: Owner, Users, Owner-Group, Groups, Everyone.
The ACL structure may be reallocated to make room for the new ACE. If so the old structure will be freed.
If the new ACE is an update of an existing entry, it will replace the old entry.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: 0 Success -DER_INVAL Invalid input -DER_NOMEM Failed to allocate required memory

section.title: daos_acl_principal_from_str()

para.computeroutput: int daos_acl_principal_from_str (const char * principal_str, enum daos_acl_principal_type * type, char ** name)

section.para: Convert a formatted principal string to an ACL principal type and name suitable for creating or looking up an Access Control Entry.

The format of the input string is:
For named user: "u:username@"
For named group: "g:groupname@"
For special types: "OWNER@", "GROUP@", or "EVERYONE@"

entry.para: Newly-allocated name string. Caller is responsible for freeing. Result may be NULL if the principal is one of the special types.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: 0 Success -DER_INVAL Invalid input -DER_NOMEM Could not allocate memory

section.title: daos_acl_principal_is_valid()
section.para: Sanity check that the principal is a properly-formatted name string for use in an Access Control List.
The check is not very strict. It verifies that the name is in the name@[domain] format, but does not make assumptions about legal characters in the name or verify that the principal actually exists

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: true if the name is properly formatted false otherwise
